availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Thomas E. Bramlette: Governor's official correspondence file, petitions for pardons, remissions, and respites 1863-1867

body.p:
State of Indiana
Floyd County } St.

I J. W. Davis upon Oath Says that I am a residen^t^ citizen of New Albany Indiana that I am personly and well acquainted with Willliam Ramsey Jun, Having Known him Since he was a small Boy. Being a near neighbor of his Father Sen, with wom he resided And Said affiant knows that Said William Ramsey Jun. sustained a good C^h^artactor for honesty and Morality up to the time of the alledge affence. Said to have been Commited by him and one Joseph Eaton
That Said William Ramsey Jur was about 17 years of age, at the ^time of the^ Commission of the of the alledge affence and further satath not
Subscribed and Sworn to before me a notary Public on this the 22nd day of July A. D. 1865.

David W Lafollette
nortary Public Floyd Co Ind.

Wm Ramsey Sr
To Gov. } J W Davis affidavit
